intro: Pedicularis vialii, commonly known as the Vial's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and semi-parasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its striking violet or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in mountainous areas. Its unique appearance and ecological adaptation make it a notable species in its habitat.
